title: Ticket #1508: Amazon EC2 ssh key file has wrong permissions
description: When submitting Amazon EC2 jobs, the amazon gahp writes the ssh private key file for logging into the instance on local disk with permissions 644. It should be using 600.
remarks:
2010-Jul-16 12:34:42 by jfrey:
Pushed a fix to V7_4-branch for 7.4.4.
check_ins: 2010-Jul-16 12:34   Check-in [18575]: Fix permissions on ssh private key file for amazon ec2 jobs. #1508 The ssh private key file that allows logging into the ec2 instance was being written with global read permissions. Now, only the owner has read permission. (By Jaime Frey )
